data.title: Open with VS Code from right click in Windows Explorer
data.body:
Feature request

**Description:**

Add possibility to open folder/file/group of selected files from windows explorer using right click menu with "Open with VS Code".
It's perfectly works with Atom, and Notepad++

**Why this feature needed:**
- Very useful
- Speed of opening project is increased

**OS:**
- Windows
- Mac OS (If it can be added to mac version - it's will be good to)

data.title: [folding] fold regions
data.body: Use markers such as //#region and //#endregion to mark folding regions

data.title: Cannot Find Name For Some Files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607
- Typescript Version: 1.8.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Typescript project
2. Only the first file I navigate to can find modules

I have a Node project running with Typescript support. When I start Code, Typescript modules are only found for the first file I open. The remaining files have the "Cannot Find Name" error for all modules. In some cases the modules are the same ones on the first file, so I know the definitions are available. If I restart VS Code or run the reload window command, then the error goes away from the first file I open, and will now show the error for all others.

Any ideas on a fix?

data.title: CPU hogging is back

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.6.0-insider (50bb7aad57cbf1924e28472de52734be49645558, 2016-09-15T06:05:10.053Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Since Recent upgrades 2. Code Insiders - Helper runs CPU to max We've optimized all folders to exclude from watching. How do we get to the where this is actually happening. It was fine till about 2 releases back. Does anyone else find the same? [Sample of Code - Insiders Helper.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/476684/Sample.of.Code.-.Insiders.Helper.txt)

data.title: [scss] timing functions in variables break syntax highlighting
Any way to store extension configuration in vscode configuration
data.body:
Is there any way that i can store my extension settings that are in the JSon format and store in vscode own configuration rather then own file ?
and retrieve from there instead of my own JSON extension setting file ?

data.title: TypeScript Language Support silently stops
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise, Version 1607

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Opened VSCode on a project with around 1-2000 ts/tsx/css files.
2. Used VSCode for around 1 hour
3. Noticed that the Language Support for TypeScript stopped working. This included intellisense, symbols, etc.

**Notes**
The issue goes away after using the 'Reload Window' command.

**Additional information**

Code processes in the process explorer
![code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1050284/18582327/bf000370-7c04-11e6-9406-07d6ddedf3ca.PNG)

Error for the VSCode dev tools
![vscode-intellisense-down](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1050284/18582382/07529c64-7c05-11e6-8bea-b57eff04a0aa.PNG)

data.title: Quick import statements
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win 10

I have watched an Angular 2 video where the instructor imports 'import statements' by typing "NgModule" for example and then it pastes in "import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'" at the top of the page.

Very similar VS (IDE) when pressing (CRTL + .) and selecting add 'using System.Web.Http' for example.

This would safe a lot of time when creating components in Angular 2.

data.title: better error reporting for misconfigured outDir
data.body: Provide better error reporting if breakpoints cannot be resolved successfully due to misconfigured source map setup.

data.title: outDir globbing: do not block if a source map cannot be loaded
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insider
- OS Version: macOS
1. git clone vscode-docker
2. in launch.json set `outDir` to `${workspaceRoot}` 
3. launch extension

Observe: ext host times out because debugger source map loading doesn't finish.

Problem: if a source map file cannot be found, the preload promise doesn't resolve.

data.title: Get keycode from 'key' when IME enabled.
data.body:
Fixes #10183.

When IME enabled, KeyboardEvent.keyCode is set 229 always.
So, case of inputting keybindings, get keycode via KeyboardEvent.key.

data.title: Unnecessary highlight "in" and "var"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.2
- OS Version:Windows 10
- Language:Typescript

"in" in the next picture is highlighted, but it's unnecessary.
I have found a few bugs about highlight, so I think maybe there are or will be still other bugs about it.

![6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8530043/18581455/45d5fb10-7c33-11e6-9468-7d746b8e9a22.PNG)

data.title: Select git remote to push to, when upstream is configured
data.body:
For some projects I have multiple remotes set up. 
It would be really nice to have an option to choose the remote to push to like in git-gui and visual studio team explorer

data.title: New window, Open File should replace untitled file
data.body:
1. Open a new window
2. Open an existing file

You'll have 2 tabs open: the original Untitled file and the selected file.

In the case the Untitled file is unmodified, it should be replaced by the selected file.

data.title: Improve workspace extension recommendation UI
data.body:
How about we change the extension viewlet dropdown menu to contain this:

```
- Extension Recommendations
  - Show Recommendations
  - _separator_
  - Show Workspace Recommendations
  - Configure Workspace Recommendations
```

The configure action is currently surfacing only through the global commands.

data.title: As a user, I should be able to obtain the identifier of the extension
data.body:
Show identifier of an extension in extension editor. This is needed at multiple places
- Installing extension from command line
- Configuring workspace recommendations
- Extension dependencies

data.title: I can't disable all :hover-like snippets/labels in the editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to eliminate any help, suggestion, hint or so that appears when you locate your mouse over any word in the editor by adding this to the settings.jsono file

// Place your settings in this file to overwrite default and user settings.
{
        "editor.quickSuggestions": false,
    "editor.quickSuggestionsDelay": 1000,
    "editor.suggestOnTriggerCharacters": false,
    "editor.wordBasedSuggestions": false,
    "editor.parameterHints": false,
    "editor.snippetSuggestions": "none",
}
1. See that you still have at least one help panel

data.title: VSCode identifies in-memory files by 'name', should use 'sourceReference'.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2

Have a debug adapter return in response to `StackTraceRequest` two `StackFrames` having sources with the same `name`, but different `sourceReference`.

Result: for both stack frames VSCode displays the same source (the first one).  When names are distinct, VSCode displays sources correctly. 
From this I am inferring that `name` is used within VSCode as a unique identifier.  IMO,  `sourceReference` attribute should be used for this purpose instead, as it was actually designed to be an id.

data.title: Extension loading ignores extensionHomePath
data.body:
From @Tyriar 

I did notice that my normal extensions were being loaded in from the default directory with both of these:

```
code-insiders --user-data-dir ~/test-data-dir --extensionHomePath ~/test-extension-path .
code-insiders --user-data-dir ~/test-data-dir --extensionHomePath=~/test-extension-path .
```

data.title: Unable to run VSCode unit tests from debug on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. run "Unit Tests" from within VS Code

=> I do not get any output
=> works on Mac

Note: maybe this is an issue with the launch config. As you can see this config executes Electron with the `ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE: true` flag:

```
{
    "name": "Unit Tests",
    "type": "node",
    "request": "launch",
    "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha",
    "runtimeExecutable": "${execPath}",
    "stopOnEntry": false,
    "args": [
        "--timeout",
        "999999"
    ],
    "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
    "runtimeArgs": [],
    "env": {
        "ELECTRON_RUN_AS_NODE": "true"
    },
    "sourceMaps": true,
    "outDir": "${workspaceRoot}/out"
}
```

data.title: Debug console no longer scrolls when output received
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. run our VS Code API tests
2. Note the output in the debug console

=> console no longer scrolls when output goes beyond visible number of lines

data.title: Visual Studio like team explorer
data.body: Need Visual Studio like team explorer, which is more useful in comparing the files from git and local repository. Code check-in and excluding files while code check-in are some great features which is missing in VS Code.
